result.execSummary:
The defendant Leonard H. Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution is Joint & Several.  Restitution may be challenged within 30 days from 05-28-15. Monthly payment schedule must be established by agent.  Restitution amount of $387.86 has been modified to zero balance owing.
Jail term is with huber privileges.
Submit an apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by agent.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. records.addlTxt:
10:03 am - 14CF23 & 14CF46 - Defendant Leonard H. Moore appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Consolidated Taylor Co. Case 15CM8 also stated by Court. Parties have received and reviewed pre-sentence investigation report. DA states agreement in Taylor Co. Case 15CM8 to dismiss and read in Ct. 1. So ordered. DA states recommendation in 14CF23 & 14CF46. Comments by victim C.R. Comments by Attorney Lex. Comments by defendant. Comments and ruling by Court. Appeal rights given. Adj. 10:26 am. 
14CF23 (Ct. 1) - Sentence withheld - 5 years probation. Conditions: 6 month jail term, with huber privileges, to commence by 06-28-15 @ 4:30 pm, may be served in any county, consecutive, 24 days credit if revoked; court costs; DNAAS; $14,930 restitution + 10% surcharge ($1493), monthly payment schedule must be established by agent - Restitution may be challenged within 30 days from today; Apologies to victims within 30 days
Taylor Co. Case 15CM8 - Dismissed and read in to 14CF23 for purposes of restitution ($387.86 + 10% surcharge) - Restitution may be challenged within 30 days from today.
14CF46 (Ct. 2) - Sentence withheld - 3 years probation. Conditions: 3 month jail term, with huber privileges, to commence by 06-28-15 @ 4:30 pm, may be served in any county, consecutive to 14CF23; court costs; DNAAS; AODA

2:09 pm - 14CF23, 14CF46, 14CM41 - Defendant Leonard H. Moore in court with attorney James R. Lex.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    DA states recommendation.  DA certifies victim rights compliance.  Defendant pleads NO CONTEST to Ct. 1 in 14CF23, Ct. 2 in 14CF46 and Ct. 1 in 14CM41.    Court questions DE regarding the plea, plea questionnaire and elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  DA comments regarding factual basis.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts pleas, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct. 1 in 14CF23, Ct. 2 in 14CF46 and Ct. 1 in 14CM41 and on motion of DA dismisses and reads-in Ct. 2 & 3 in 14CF23 and Ct. 1 in 14CF46.  Court orders PSI on both felony charges.  Comments by Atty. Lex regarding sentencing recommendation in 14CM41.  Court imposes (14CM41):  Sentence withheld - 1 year probation.  Conditions:  $500 fine, inclusive of costs; $45 SBDA; $200 DNAAS.  Clarification of Ct. 1 in 14CF23.  Sentencing set for 04-30-15 @ 9:00 am.  Adj. 2:27 pm.
